data.description: Company Overview​At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with our people. We’re a global close-knit community, united by the relentless pursuit to help keep people safer everywhere. Our critical communications, video security and command center technologies support public safety agencies and enterprises alike, enabling the coordination that’s critical for safer communities, safer schools, safer hospitals and safer businesses. Connect with a career that matters, and help us build a safer future. Department OverviewThe Global Sales Operations team at Motorola Solutions is dedicated to maximizing the effectiveness of our global sales force. We empower our sellers and sales leaders with the tools and insights they need. As an intern on our team you will gain valuable experience in the dynamic world of sales operations. You will work closely with the Customer Data Management team, providing you with a unique opportunity to understand the sales cycle, apply analytic skills and contribute to strategic programs.This internship offers a unique opportunity to learn from experienced professionals, contribute to a high-performing team, and gain valuable skills in the field of sales operations.Job DescriptionWho you are: You are passionate and eager to make a real impact. You'll be more than just an intern; you'll be a key player in shaping how we understand and engage with our customers and sales teams. You'll be at the forefront of our data and sales revolution, diving deep into customer data, governance and driving impactful change across the organization. If you're a highly organized, detail-oriented individual with a passion for operations and a desire to learn and grow, we encourage you to apply! What You'll Do: In this role, you'll be a part of the Global Customer Data Management Team under the Global Sales Enablement & Effectiveness organization. In Customer Data Management, you will play a crucial part in ensuring our data is accurate, complete, and reliable. You will be collaborating with business stakeholders, data stewards, and IT to drive data quality, implement tools and processes, and champion data governance best practices.  And that's not all! You'll have amazing opportunities to collaborate with fellow interns on a high-impact group project to be presented at the end of the internship, and you'll participate in exclusive events and activities that will immerse you in Motorola Solutions' dynamic culture.Here's how you'll rock the MSI world:Data Whisperer: Decode the secrets hidden in customer data, uncovering valuable opportunities that will shape our sales strategies.Collaboration Catalyst: Team up with sales, ops, IT, data stewards, and other rockstars to create a data-driven culture that fuels success. Data Detective: Identify opportunities to improve customer data quality and champion data governance best practices.Data Matchmaker: Play a crucial role in merging and integrating data from different sources, ensuring seamless transitions and a unified view of our customers.Problem-Solving Ninja: Fearlessly tackle data challenges, taking ownership of issues and driving them to resolution with your ninja-like skills.Change Agent: Empower business partners with the knowledge and tools they need to become data masters.Agile Adaptor: Thrive in a fast-paced environment, juggling multiple priorities and adapting to evolving challenges with ease.This internship offers: Real-World Experience Master the Data. Immerse yourself in the world of customer data, gaining hands-on experience in data management, governance, and quality.Impactful Contributions:Shape the Future. Make a direct impact on the company's data roadmap, influencing how we engage with customers and drive business growth.Collaborative environment: Work with a dynamic and supportive team in a fast-paced, collaborative setting. Partner with other interns in related functions to drive and deliver a final team project and presentation.Mentorship and development: Receive guidance and mentorship from experienced data professionals.Qualifications:Skills:Exceptional attention to detailStrong communication skills (verbal and written)Strong analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to learn new software and data management toolsHigh degree of organization, accuracy, and flexibilityBehavioral CharacteristicsFlexibility to respond to varied priorities within the deadlines, working both independently and with a team to manage evolving processes at short noticeAbility to build partnerships and effectively establish and maintain relationships with internal business partners Comfortable interacting with different levels of leadership and leading cross-functional, cross-regional projectsCollaborative – you know how to give and receive feedback in a constructive wayProactive approach to problem identification and solvingNote: Candidate must be in the Chicago office 3 days per week. #LI-JS3#LI-HYBRIDBasic RequirementsHigh School Diploma is requiredMust be pursuing a minimum of a Bachelor's Degree with a graduation date of December 2026 or laterLegal authorization to work in the U.S. indefinitely is required. Employer work permit sponsorship is not available for this position.Travel RequirementsNoneRelocation ProvidedNonePosition TypeInternEEO StatementMotorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally-protected characteristic. We are proud of our people-first and community-focused culture, empowering every Motorolan to be their most authentic self and to do their best work to deliver on the promise of a safer world. If you’d like to join our team but feel that you don’t quite meet all of the preferred skills, we’d still love to hear why you think you’d be a great addition to our team.We’re committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruiting experience for candidates with disabilities, or other physical or mental health conditions. To request an accommodation, please complete this Reasonable Accommodations Form so we can assist you.
